file_content.text: Good luck securing Shange. I'll be waiting for your call.
Hello? Is anyone still alive?
My lord? Perhaps you can salvage this debacle.
Wait... you're that bounty hunter. Perhaps you can help me.
Sir? Not sure what you're doing there... perhaps you can salvage this debacle.
Hmm. You're not with the team... but you're still breathing, which says something. Maybe you can salvage this fiasco.
I'm Commander Byten, Imperial Non-human Relations. My men were extracting a key political prisoner from the lower cells. Something went wrong.
Obviously--I couldn't have engineered a more thorough bloodbath myself.
This is quite a scene.
Yes, the pile of corpses does suggest a slight hitch in your plan.
This is quite a scene.
Looks like your boys ran into something with teeth. Lots of teeth.
This is quite a scene.
"Wrong" doesn't begin to cover it.
This is quite a scene.
I heard the feeding frenzy over the comm. Very illuminating.
Who were you trying to extract?
What political prisoner?
I assume you treat us non-humans with the same respect you give your own kind?
Cute job title.
Of course. The Empire is nothing without the support of its allies.
"Non-human Relations"? That's your actual position?
Cute job title.
I facilitate diplomacy with our foreign associates.
My men were after a Cathar noble. "Prince" Shange. Revolutionary type, opposed the Cathar joining the Republic.
Republic intelligence wanted him quiet, so they abducted him and his followers. They've had him in stasis here for twenty years now.
This Shange must be itching for a little payback.
I'll bet he's angry.
Shange hasn't had a conscious thought in two decades.
What makes this Shange so special?
Why is the Cathar important?
That's one way to shut a troublemaker up.
Harsh, but effective.
I would have had him killed--but if the Republic insists on mercy, that's their mistake.
Shange was a celebrated hero on Cathar. We free him, he'll blow the lid off the kidnapping, the imprisonment, all of it.
A scandal like that could ruin the Republic's reputation with any number of species. Unfortunately, my team is monster-chow. Can you free Shange?
A chance to discredit the Republic is too ripe an opportunity to pass up.
You bet.
Where is he?
He must still be in stasis nearby. The power in the area is down, so you'll have to reboot the control generators first.
Whatever creatures killed my men can't be far, so be on your guard. Contact me once you've released Shange and his cohorts.
Not my job. [Refuse quest]
I see. I don't suppose anyone else will pass by there....
